subject: Management
title: Delegating Across Levels
description: A quick, practical guide to Delegating Across Levels.

hook.text: A director delegated directly to an intern, skipping two managers. Chaos followed.

buildup.text: Delegating too far down the hierarchy creates confusion about authority and accountability.

discovery.text: Effective delegation usually goes one level down. That person can then sub-delegate.

twist.text: Skip-level delegation undermines the middle manager and confuses the recipient.

climax.text: Respect the chain. Delegate to your direct report and let them delegate further.

punchline.text: Delegate one level down, not five.

quiz.question: Why is skip-level delegation usually a problem?
options: It undermines middle managers and confuses authority
It moves too slowly through the chain
It gives too much power to junior staff
